definitions.definition: Behavior exhibiting excessive or uncontrollable emotions , in a wide range from joy to panic but usually including anxiety or fear.
A mental disorder characterized by emotional excitability etc. without an organic cause .
Any disorder of women with some psychiatric symptoms without other diagnosis, ascribed to uterine influences on the female body, lack of pregnancy, or lack of sex.
definitions.label_groups: psychiatry , until early 20th century , now historical

main_definition: Behavior exhibiting excessive or uncontrollable emotions , in a wide range from joy to panic but usually including anxiety or fear.
secondary_definitions: ( medicine , nosologically dated ) A mental disorder characterized by emotional excitability etc. without an organic cause .
( informal , psychopathology ) Synonym of conversion disorder .

( psychiatry , until early 20th century , now historical ) Any disorder of women with some psychiatric symptoms without other diagnosis, ascribed to uterine influences on the female body, lack of pregnancy, or lack of sex.
